html:
Martin's Tavern

“My grandfather was a very stocky, good looking Irishman with blond hair and I was told at one point that when they were bringing a caravan of whiskey down from up north, there was a scene almost out of Elliott Ness, if you will.

Kahn Directs a Tour de Force Hamlet

The king of Denmark has been murdered and his son Hamlet comes home from school to deal with all the craziness of his family’s situation. Some think he is going mad, and this is a madcap play with plenty of humor.

Dynamic Duo

C plus C equals Curtis & Cosby, the new dynamic duo coming to 77 WABC on February 6th weekdays from 12-3 PM. Collectively they have been called charismatic, controversial, legends, iconic, feisty, spirited, award winning – and both share a Polish heritage.

Tudor Nights in the City of Light March 8

Join Tudor Place on March 8 from 6:30-8:30 pm for an evening in the City of Light, where newlyweds Armistead 3rd and Caroline Peter painted and socialized in the 1920s among artists and writers of the so-called lost generation.

Dumbarton House Hosts Homeschool History Days

Introduce students to our nation’s past through hands-on programming at Dumbarton House. Homeschool History Days begins February 22 and runs through May 31, 2018.

Women's Rights Priority for Kosovo's Ambassador

It is a true story of a road traveled from being a refugee to becoming an ambassador to the United States.

Now among the growing cadre of women ambassadors here in Washington is Kosovo’s Vlora Ҫitaku, the ex-refugee.

Don't Want to Cook? No Problem!

No one wants to cook anymore. Who can blame them? We're all so busy. When you get home from work, you're exhausted, right? Simply too tired to cook a meal, or not willing to use up valuable relaxation time for cooking.

The Impossible Dream: The Speech Trump Should Have Given

Brilliant scientists from MIT and Berkeley deployed a powerful ray gun against President Trump before his State of the Union speech. This brain-altering gadget did not kill him. Instead it jacked up his IQ 50 points as intended, gave him a conscience and forced him to tell the truth. Wait.

'Hillbilly Elegy'

“Our goal is to serve the American people in ways that lead to a positive and achievable outcome – a strong civil society, healthy communities, civil discourse, freedom of the press and a commitment to lifelong learning beginning with our youngest citizens.

GU Hosts Cardinal Joseph Tobin on Defending Immigrants and Refugees

Cardinal Joseph Tobin, who has accompanied immigrants to deportation hearings and challenged restrictions on resettling refugees, will outline the moral, human and religious imperatives for defending immigrants and refugees in the current national debate.

Marion Meadows Live at Blues Alley Valentine's Day

American saxophonist, composer, and contemporary jazz recording artist, Marion Meadows will be performing live at Blues Alley February 14, 2018. Meadows has released a total of 13 albums.

Kreeger Art Talks

It’s the museum you might forget is right around the corner. Well, around several corners but at 2401 Foxhall Road NW, so close.

Guten Appetit!

Foie Gras Two Ways: “The grilled Foie Gras terrine is topped with a little bit of golden raisin and cherry on a buttery brioche.

Who's Your Ultra Violet Valentine?

Designed by hand, delivered by hand, Fabio and his stellar team create exquisite floral arrangements especially for you and your loved ones.

3 Tenors + 1

The 2018 Pre-Alfalfa Luncheon boasted of hearing the on-stage wisdom from “3 Tenors of Foreign Policy.” But a 4th tenor, former Missouri Congressman James Symington, delivered the sweetest sounds.

The Grill Room & RdV Vineyards Host Wine Dinner at Rosewood

The Grill Room at The Rosewood Hotel in Georgetown is launching a special Wine Dinner Series with four dinners in February, March, and April, showcasing unique wines from vineyards across the U.S.

Oculoire Photographs at Cross MacKenzie Gallery

Cross MacKenzie Gallery is pleased to present this inaugural exhibition of photographs by Oculoire.

Meet Hamilton Table Author Laura Kumin March 13

As its Kennedy Center debut nears, has Hamilton fever got you in its grip? Spend an evening with him and his dining companions at Tudor Place on March 13, 2018 from 6:00 to 8:00 pm.

Hillwood Hosts Great Homes and Gardens Series

Escape the cold Washington winter and immerse yourself in the stories of luscious garden estates with Hillwood Estate, Museum and Gardens' Great Homes and Gardens Lecture Series.

French Embassy Hosts International Shorts Film Festival Jan. 25

The International Shorts Film Festival presents 10 short films selected from more than a thousand submissions from all over the world on January 25, 2018 from 7:00 to 9:30 pm.

Fearless Woman Honored

For Barbara Brown Hawthorn, being a “Fearless Woman”…. is really about asking oneself: “What can I do to make a better life for others?”

'The Profiles'

“My faith has been a lifeline for me.

Pop Icons at Artist's Proof

Artist’s Proof is pleased to announce the group exhibition POP ICONS by French sculptor Helder Batista and American painter John Stango.

Voxare String Quartet at Dumbarton Oaks

Music at Dumbarton Oaks is featuring Voxare String Quartet February 11 and 12, 2018.

'To Future Women' at The Phillips Collection

From January 21 to February 14, The Phillips Collection is hosting To Future Women, an interactive artwork that marks the annive

WFP Presents Architecturally Stunning Dupont Circle Penthouse

Looking for a a truly impressive and one-of-a-kind penthouse?

Seize the New Year! It's Urgent!

What are your hopes, dreams and desires for 2018? The new year is a valuable opportunity to improve the quality of your life and happiness. Here's how to make the best of it...

Carol Schwartz at Christ Church Feb. 8

Georgetown Village invites the community to hear Carol Schwartz discuss her new memoir, Quite A Life!

Design Legend Charlotte Moss Dazzles at Washington Winter Show

Honorary Chair of the 2018 Washington Winter Show (WWS), New York-based designer Charlotte Moss enthralled luncheon guests Friday with a talk on her masterful and luxurious garden and home design projects.
Crocs Rock the Embassy of Australia Launching 'Year of Mateship'

Say What? No Cell Phones in Georgetown!

You know who you are. You can't get through a meal without photographing your entrée or texting friends. Imagine watching a Hoyas game with no cell phone.

*/

Six Habits to Bulletproof Your Morning

I happen to be a morning person by intention. There is something inspiring about starting my day in the dark, and secret found-time that occurs before the sun rises; where the hours are slow and the day is filled with infinite possibilities. But to be honest, it wasn't always like this.

Kim Waters Live at Blues Alley Feb. 22

On February 22, 2018 Blues Alley will be featuring jazz musician Kim Waters.

Bon Anniversaire!

Lynda Webster was born on New Years Day …… the first baby born on New Years Day in Macomb Township, McDonough County, Illinois to be exact. “I quickly learned it was the worst day of the year besides Christmas to have a birthday.

'On Your Feet!' at Kennedy Center Now

On Your Feet! will be at the Kennedy Center from Tuesday, January 9 through Sunday, January 28, 2018

Winter Restaurant Week Jan. 22-28

Restaurant Association Metropolitan Washington (RAMW) Winter Restaurant Week is from January 22-28, 2018.

Ice Skating in Georgetown

Through February, enjoy ice skating in Georgetown at The Washington Harbour.

DC's New Recycling Rules

After you take away the Christmas tree, it's time to focus on DC Department of Public Works' new recycling requirement with its expanded list of items, effective January 1, 2018. All part of a citywide goal of getting 80 percent of waste out of landfills.

A Season of Music With The Phillips Collection

The Phillips Collection is hosting a season of music at the Anderson House while the Phillips original house undergoes a thermal upgrade project.

Charm of Chinoiserie at WWS Jan. 12-14

The 2018 Washington Winter Show (WWS) welcomes back many familiar faces with over 40 dealers from across the U.S. and Europe, offering a broad range of exquisite antiques and fine arts.

Wine & Sweets at Malmaison Jan. 14

On Sunday, January 14, 2018 from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm, experience some of Italy's finest wines, paired with Malmaison's renowned Pastry Chef, Ruth Stoltzfus, house-made delectable desserts.

Gypsy Sally's Presents a Tribute to David Bowie

Gypsy Sally's presents Life on Mars: A Tribute to David Bowie on Saturday, January 6, 2018. Doors open at 7:00 pm and the show starts at 9:00 pm.
Best of 2017 Parties: Part II

Catch Vermeer Before It Closes

Vermeer and the Masters of Genre Painting: Inspiration and Rivalry exhibition at the National Gallery of Art will be closing on January 21, 2018.
Best of 2017 Parties: Part I

2018 Toast to Georgetown

We begin our ninth year with gratitude.

Thank you for contributing to, supporting and reading The Georgetown Dish.

Wishing you a 2018 filled with love, prosperity and peace.

Weekend Tots: Noon Year's Eve at Tudor Place

Enjoy a festive counting-themed story time, then count down together to 12:00 pm on Sunday, December 31, 2017.

French Embassy New Year's Dance Soiree Jan. 13

Celebrate the New Year with an evening of music, French wine, Parisian desserts & dancing on Saturday, January 13, 2018 from 7:00 to 10:30 pm at the Embassy of France.

Au Revoir

“Most of you think that you have been invited by Francesca and in a sense it’s true,” joked Gérard Araud, The Ambassador of France at a reception he hosted in her honor as she says goodbye to her post as Social Secretary and moves on to MPAA (Motion Picture Assoc

New Year's Eve with Bonerama and New Orleans Suspects

Looking for a jazzy way to say adieu 2017? Head to The Hamilton for a special New Year’s Eve performance by Bonerama and New Orleans Suspects.
